title: Susan B. Anthony Papers: Daybook and Diaries, 1856-1906; Diaries; 1873

entries.fullText: No. 7 - Madison Street
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony wrote a short entry stating her address in Rochester, U.S.

entries.summaryText: Journal entries for December 1873

entries.summaryText: Journal entry containing information about taxes and rates for tobacco, liquor, and wine.

entries.fullText:
RATES OF POSTAGE.

Domestic. -- On all Letters, throughout the United States 3 cents for each half ounce or fraction thereof.
Drop or Local Letters, 2 cents per half ounce where there is a free carrier's delivery; other offices, 1 cent.
Postal Cards, 1 cent.
Valuable Letters may be registered by the payment of a registration fee of 15 cents.
Money can be sent with absolute safety by mail by procuring a Money Order. The fees are, on orders not exceeding $20, 10 cents; $20 to $30, 15 cents; $30 to $40, 20 cents; $40 to $50, 25 cents.
Circulars, unsealed, 2 cents for each 2 ounces.
Printed Boos, in one package, to one address, 2 cents for each 2 ounces or fraction thereof.
On Transient Newspapers, or other Printed Matter (Books and Circulars excepted), and on Seeds, Cuttings, &c., Pamphlets, Book Manuscripts and Proof Sheets, Maps, Engravings, Blanks, Patterns, Envelopes and Photographs, contained in one pagckage to one address, 1 ct. for each 2 ounces or fraction thereof.
All Transient Matter, except duly certified letters of Soldiers and Sailors, must be prepaid by stamps.
On matters not above specified, same rate as letters.
No package will be forwarded which weighs over four pounds, except books, published or circulated by order of Congress.
Foreign. --On Letters to Great Britain and Ireland. --For every half ounce or fraction thereof, 6 cts. if prepaid. If not prepaid, 6 cts. extra will be collected in Great Britain, and 6 cents in the United States.
To the German States.--For every half ounce or fraction thereof, via N. German Union direct, 6 cts.; closed mail, via England, 7 cts., prepayment options.
To France (payment compulsory).--10 cts. for each half ounce or fraction thereof, direct mail; 4 cts. (open mail) by England. Fully prepaid, via Engtland, one-third ounce, 10cts.; one-third to one-half ounce, 16 cts.; one-half to two-thirds ounce, 20 cts.; two-thirds to one ounce, 26 cts.
To the Dominion of Canada, per half ounce, any distance, 6 cts. if prepaid; if not paid, 10 cts.
To Newfoundland.--10 cts. per half ounce on letters sent, prepayment compulsory; and 10 cts. collected on letters received.
entries.summaryText: Journal entry containing information about domestic and foreign postage rates.

entries.fullText: Mother & Huldah Anthony dined at Sister Hannah's - fine sleying - just a year ago - was snow-bound on the Union Pacific R.R.
entries.summaryText: Mother & Huldah Anthony dined at Sister Hannah's.

entries.fullText: Attorney J. Van Voorhees went to Buffalo with my Petition for Habeus Corpus - & U.S. Com ? all round to get bail bonds for the 15 women Put in Powers Bank $44.50 - all yet received -
entries.summaryText: Attorney J. Van Voorhees went to Buffalo with my Petition for Habeus Corpus.

entries.fullText: Judge Hall returns the Petition the 10th ? - saw both Judge S & Van Voorhees - Hall considered an honest Judge - - got Bay Rum - Alcohol, Brandy, Arnine & Camphor bottles replenished - out of feeling that such would be dear Father's order - always ready for sickness
entries.summaryText: Judge Hall returns the Petition the 10th ? - saw both Judge S & Van Voorhees.

entries.fullText: Letter from V. C. Woodhull offering her legal aid in any U.S. prosecution - E. M Davis asking if I ever was in jail - Gave Davis full statement - no reply to W -
entries.summaryText: Received letter from V. C. Woodhull offering legal aid and was asked by E. M Davis if I ever was in jail.

entries.fullText: Went to Church with Aaron - Writing
entries.summaryText: Went to church with Aaron and did some writing.

entries.fullText: Writing
entries.summaryText: Did some writing at home.

entries.fullText: Writing
entries.summaryText: Did some writing at home.

entries.fullText: Writing Constitutional argument
entries.summaryText: Worked on writing a constitutional argument at home.

entries.fullText: Writing - close
entries.summaryText: Finished up some writing at home.

entries.fullText: Judge Hall returns writ of Habeus Corpus - go Buffalo -- The judge refused hearing - U.S. District Crowley not prepared to make arg't for gov't. - Put off till June 21st at Albany Marshall Keeney in charge -
entries.summaryText: Judge Hall refused hearing on writ of Habeus Corpus in Buffalo, put off until June 21st in Albany with Marshall Keeney in charge.

entries.fullText: Took train at 5 P.M. for New York - Marshall Keeney at depot - quite protested against my going -
entries.summaryText: Took train to New York, Marshall Keeney protested against my going.

entries.fullText: New York breakfasted at Mrs Phelps - E. C. Brown - Chatfield called - Mrs. Phelps & Mrs Pearsal told me of Mrs Hooker's visit - and Tiltons wish to see me when I [?] come - I left word - when he would bring his wife along - & I would talk to them together but never separate - *reached Washington at 7 A.M. Mrs Gage with me —*
entries.summaryText: Had breakfast at Mrs Phelps in New York, received a message from Mrs Hooker and Tiltons wish to see me, arrived in Washington with Mrs Gage.

entries.fullText: Breakfasted at Mrs Phelps & took 10 A.M. train for Albany - arrived at 9 P.M., found Paker Pillsbury and Phebe Jones - & both Selden & Van Voorhees at the Delevan. I went to Lydia Motts
entries.summaryText: Took train to Albany, arrived at 9 P.M., met with Paker Pillsbury, Phebe Jones, Selden, and Van Voorhees at the Delevan, went to Lydia Motts.

entries.fullText: Washington - National Hotel - brothers D.R. & Sidney Clark here - Mrs A.C. ? Des Moines & Mrs ? Henderson -
entries.summaryText: Stayed at National Hotel in Washington, met with brothers D.R. and Sidney Clark, Mrs A.C. from Des Moines, and Mrs Henderson.

entries.fullText: Washington - D.C.- Brother D.R. called with me on Gen. Sutter & Mrs Pomeroy - Had a good many calls - Mrs Stanton arrived - bringing son Kit - to get appointed of judgeship in some territory - sad -
entries.summaryText: Met with D.R., Gen. Sutter, Mrs Pomeroy, Mrs Stanton, and her son Kit who was seeking a judgeship in some territory.

entries.fullText:
National U.S. Convention - at
Washington - D.C. - Large
meetings - all stopped at
National Hotel - E.M. Davis.
Robert Purvis - Mrs Houston, Gage
Blake, Lockwood & Spencer -
Dr. Mary Walker on hand -
entries.summaryText: National U.S. Convention in Washington D.C. with many attendees staying at the National Hotel. Several notable people were present including E.M. Davis, Robert Purvis, Mrs Houston, Gage Blake, Lockwood, Spencer, and Dr. Mary Walker.

entries.fullText:
National U.S. Convention
Lincoln Hall - Project to
form Stock Co. for a Woman's
National Paper -
entries.summaryText: National U.S. Convention discussing the formation of a stock company for a woman's national paper.

entries.fullText:
Committee meeting at the
National Hotel - every one in
favor of Stock Co. & new national
paper-
entries.summaryText: Committee meeting at the National Hotel with everyone in favor of the stock company and new national paper.

entries.fullText:
Mrs Stanton & Mrs Gage
worked up report - & Mrs Stanton
would not allow Dr. Walker's name
to be mentioned in it - I protested
but to no purpose - it is [?]
the Lucy Stone [Dost??] [?] -
. Took tram at 9.P.M. - Chairs
instead of sleeping birth (sic) - harried
entries.summaryText: Mrs. Stanton and Mrs. Gage worked on a report but Mrs. Stanton would not allow Dr. Walker's name to be mentioned. The author protested but to no avail. The report is related to Lucy Stone. The author took a tram at 9 PM but had to sit in a chair instead of a sleeping berth and was in a hurry.

entries.fullText:
both of us breakfasted with
the Phelps - I took 10. Train Albany
- arrived at 3.P.M. found P. Pillsbury
at Phebe Jones - I stopped at Lydia Motts
- Selden, Van Vhoores, sic, (Voorhees) at Delevan -
saw Mr & Mrs Lockett [?] - told of
of Geo. Baker loosing, sic, $800. --
entries.summaryText: The author had breakfast with the Phelps and took a train to Albany. They arrived at 3 PM and met with P. Pillsbury at Phebe Jones. The author stopped at Lydia Motts and saw Selden, Van Vhoores, Mr. and Mrs. Lockett. The author was told about Geo. Baker losing $800.

entries.fullText:
U.S. District Court at Albany.
Judge N.H. Hall - hearing
in P.M. - Judge Selden's arg't
vastly improved - Hall denied
petition for Habeus Corpus & remanded
me back to Marshall Keny [Keeney]
entries.summaryText: The author attended a U.S. District Court hearing in Albany with Judge N.H. Hall presiding. Judge Selden's argument was vastly improved but Hall denied the petition for Habeus Corpus and remanded the author back to Marshall Keny.

entries.fullText: At L. Motts made my agreement to frone "male" in the U.S. Constitutes Null & Void. Before the Const. Comission - the judge pronounced it strong & clear - Mr. Van Vhooris [Voorhees] left this ? after my lecture -
entries.summaryText: Agreement made null and void in Albany with L. Motts.

entries.fullText: Grand jury not yet brought in against us women - Judge Selden, Telegraphed home to have his cases then put over - so he could stay & give my bail - P.P. left this P.M. for Salem O. -
entries.summaryText: Awaiting grand jury decision and Judge Selden bails Susan B. Anthony.

entries.fullText: Judge Selden bailed me $1000. Terrible snow storm - train delayed west & south - got proofs of Judge Selden's arg't at 9 - & took ten trains for N. Y.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is bailed by Judge Selden and faces a snow storm.

entries.fullText: New York - Breakfasted at cousin E. Caldwells - all well - called on M. Phelps, Milhoun & Murray - then Tribune Times, Sun, Herald, World, with proof of Judge Seldens argument - took 4 P.M. train to Phila, sic, - E.M. Davis west line at Miss Mampheras at 8 - and & took train at 11.25 - and
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits family and newspapers in New York before traveling to Philadelphia.

entries.fullText: Reached Washington D.C. Breakfasted with Emma Griffins - called Miss Darmands & Annie to N. Purvis to dinner & then to A.A. Sargents - back warm welcome
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrives in Washington D.C. and has breakfast with Emma Griffins before visiting friends.

entries.fullText: Washington - Terrible snow storm - still made round to look after business
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony faces a snow storm while conducting business in Washington.

entries.fullText: Mr. Purnis's (?) daughter Georgie with me called on senator, ?? delightful interview.
entries.summaryText: Visited senator with Mr. Purnis's daughter Georgie.

entries.fullText: Called Mrs S.C. Pomeroy - she she answered don't believe whether ?? - Pomeroy changed with bribery to gain re-election.
entries.summaryText: Visited Mrs. S.C. Pomeroy and discussed bribery allegations against Pomeroy.

entries.fullText: Mrs B Handler & Mrs. ? Winslow called at Mrs Dargents (?)
entries.summaryText: Visited Mrs. Dargents with Mrs. B Handler and Mrs. ? Winslow.

entries.fullText:
Mrs. Sargent with me
called on Justice Wayne
& Justice Strong --
the former audited [?]
at Selden's argument --
latter refused it. [?]
entries.summaryText: Mrs. Sargent visits Justice Wayne and Justice Strong with Susan B. Anthony in Washington.

entries.fullText:
Left Washington
at 9:40 P.M. -- Mr. [?]
in company - Lunched with
Mrs. Ruth B. Swanson.
Called on Senator Summer --
Mrs. Pomeroy refused to
see me again.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony leaves Washington and has lunch with Mrs. Ruth B. Swanson and visits Senator Summer, but Mrs. Pomeroy refuses to see her again.

entries.fullText:
Breakfast at Miss Thomsons
then to 321 [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony has breakfast at Miss Thomson's and then goes to 321.

entries.fullText:
Parlor meeting at
J Childs -- large &
pleasant -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a large and pleasant parlor meeting at J Childs.

entries.fullText:
Bishop Simpsons
lecture in Con. Constitution
Hall - excellent - woman
the moral supplement of
men - or hence needed in
gov't-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends Bishop Simpson's lecture at Constitution Hall about the importance of women in government.

entries.fullText:
Philadelphia -
at 33[?] -- Wrote letters to 1 P.M.
to 114 dined - bus to
Germantown - B [?] Ames
Wife Fanny B. - pleasant
reception - had large circle
invited for [?] evening the [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Philadelphia, writes letters, dines, and has a pleasant reception with B [?] Ames and his wife Fanny B. in Germantown.

entries.fullText:
early. Ames I[????[-Ps man]
a fallen angel or an improved
animal - Caroline Stratton
& daughter Augusta Needles at
Roadside- some 50 at
Lucretia's parlor meeting
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a meeting at Roadside with Caroline Stratton and Augusta Needles and later attends a parlor meeting at Lucretia's.

entries.fullText:
Left Roadside at 9 -,
Dear L.M. in rocking chair
Sewing Carpet rugs - bright & lovely
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony leaves Roadside and visits L.M. in Baltimore who is sewing carpet rugs.

entries.fullText:
The Spiritualist talk
Dr. Child tended the
door & gave me $50
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a Spiritualist talk and receives $50 from Dr. Child.

entries.fullText:
[Ch?]at Friends Meeting - A.M.
Citizen suffrage mtg P.M.
Abbington meeting in evening -
Edmond Lukens - Geo. Ridgeway
Terrific snowy evening -
Lucretia in Town all day -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends multiple meetings and encounters Edmond Lukens and Geo. Ridgeway on a snowy day.

entries.fullText:
Took N. Penn. train at 8. - two
miles to Depot - Auburn 4:30 - J
Wright at Depot - dreadfully tired
- Warm reception & hot chocolate
& Then to bed -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony takes a train to Auburn and meets J Wright at the depot where she receives a warm reception and hot chocolate.

entries.fullText:
Geo W Wyatt
Cousin David Anthony met me
Cayuga Ridge - Splendid audience
- tip top visit -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony meets with Geo W Wyatt and Cousin David Anthony at Cayuga Ridge and has a splendid visit with a great audience.

entries.fullText:
Sept - 7.25 -arrived 12 noon
called to see Maggie & [?] -
Gula looks feeble enough --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrived in Rochester and visited Maggie and Gula.
Susan B. Anthony stayed at home.

entries.fullText: Took Train at 10 P.M.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony took a train from Rochester.

entries.fullText:
Ohio State Woman Suffrage
Society Annual Meeting -
reached T. at noon - went direct
to L.L. Ro. Williams - Mrs Longely &
Mrs Jenny there -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the Ohio State Woman Suffrage Society Annual Meeting in Toledo and met with Mrs Longely and Mrs Jenny.

entries.fullText:
Ohio State W. S. Meeting
In P.M. Mr Dussett spoke of the
Woodhull arrest & its injustice - & there
was great flattery -- when I was
through with my argument - I just
wheeled into the work of telling them my
mind - That W. was the first woman
who had succeeded in fashioning to
his own ideal - so
that she theoretically accepted man's
practical theory of promising
change - Took train to
Chicago Wednesday night
6 clock -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the Ohio State Woman Suffrage Society Annual Meeting and spoke about Victoria Woodhull's arrest and her own views on women's rights. She then took a train to Chicago.
Susan B. Anthony did not write an entry for this day.

entries.fullText: Suffrage Society Annual Meeting - Small audience Aunt A.E. Dickinson at meeting --
entries.summaryText: Attended Suffrage Society Annual Meeting in Chicago with Aunt A.E. Dickinson.

entries.fullText: Went to Aunt A.E.D.'s & to [?] Hannah Doyle's & dined -- & Ms. Jones carriage came for me--
entries.summaryText: Visited Aunt A.E.D. and Hannah Doyle, and dined with Ms. Jones.

entries.fullText: Ms James - [?] terribly cold day - suppered in Dr Riders church heard Mrs. Livermore preach
entries.summaryText: Attended church at Dr. Riders and heard Mrs. Livermore preach.

entries.fullText: At Mrs Jones on [?] Ms Jones & self went to Dr Riders church to hear Mrs. Livermore preach - immortality subject - it was flat- Ms Daggett there - called Mrs. Daggetts in P.M.
entries.summaryText: Visited Mrs. Jones and attended church at Dr. Riders to hear Mrs. Livermore preach on immortality. Met with Ms Daggett and visited Mrs. Daggetts in the afternoon.

entries.fullText: Mrs. Mary Hamilton Williams & Mrs. L.M. Ninde - Became faint & full of pain when lecture was half done - & stopped & was taken to Mrs Williams - [?] & Doctor - seem to total suppression of action -
entries.summaryText: Attended a lecture in Fort Wayne with Mrs. Mary Hamilton Williams and Mrs. L.M. Ninde. Became faint and was taken to Mrs. Williams' home for medical attention.

entries.fullText: Mrs. Williams too kind & attentive - but she gave me most kindly rest & nursing Mrs. Ninde called also Mr Williams mother
entries.summaryText: Received rest and nursing from Mrs. Williams and was visited by Mrs. Ninde and Mr Williams' mother.

entries.fullText:
Still better to day
Mrs Williams invited
in company this [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about being invited by Mrs. Williams.

entries.fullText:
S. B. Beshore -
Feeling not yet strong -
& went on to platform
with fear & trembling
lest I should I not get
through - but did - large house
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about speaking at a large house in Marion, Indiana and feeling nervous.

entries.fullText:
Took train for
Home - Mr Wilsons
Jon Jason called - he
is a Dunker at Marion.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about taking a train home and receiving a visit from Jon Jason, a Dunker from Marion.

entries.fullText:
- Buffalo at 5 A.M. -
breakfasted National Hotel -
called E. K. Dakers - Cousin G.
0 [?fails ] - Orelle Derman's - &
their home at 6 P.M. - found
Harry Daker ill with measles -
[?] staid at Maggies
all night
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her travels to Buffalo, visiting various people, and staying the night at Maggie's due to Harry Daker being ill with measles.

entries.fullText:
Staid with Maggie
& the children. Harry
pretty sick - measles always
dreadful - I staid at
Maggies this night -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about staying with Maggie and her sick child Harry, who has measles.

entries.fullText:
voted at
city election - Mrs Pulver & Mrs
Hubbard - [?] three of us -
Inspectors wanted all to
vote again - but the rest
of women all frightened
lest fine & imprisonment
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about voting in the city election with Mrs. Pulver and Mrs. Hubbard, and the inspectors wanting them to vote again but the other women being too frightened.

entries.fullText:
Mary with Maggie
& children last night - report better, all
[?] Maggie with Head - I went
after dinner - got Maggie into a
sweat - with gruel, [?] -
& feet in hot water - & then gone
dripping shut - & home at 10 P.M.
entries.summaryText: Mary and Maggie's children are better. Susan helped Maggie with a sweat and hot water treatment.

entries.fullText:
At Home all day -
May Raker Loemm's
husband & Sarah Baker (David)
arrived at sister Hannah -
May staid last night at Maggie
- all better - Gula & Aaron dinner
with Maggie -
entries.summaryText: Susan stayed at home all day. May Raker Loemm's husband and Sarah Baker arrived at sister Hannah's. May stayed at Maggie's. Gula and Aaron had dinner with Maggie.

entries.fullText:
Electric bath in A.M.
Paid Judge Selden $200 - said it
came very opportune - J. Van Vhooris $75
which left only $2.45 in bank -
entries.summaryText: Susan took an electric bath in the morning. She paid Judge Selden $200 and J. Van Vhooris $75, leaving only $2.45 in the bank.

entries.fullText:
Jenny [?] met us [?] train --
pleasant visit with Mrs H. &
very nice meeting -- in the
Old Church --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Bushnells Basin and has a pleasant meeting with Mrs. H and Jenny.

entries.fullText:
Charles True & James Hughes
Baptist Church -- stopped at
Seymour Daughters -- Fine [?]
Audience -- Sister H.
got sliver in thimble finger
first joint this day --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Pittsford and attends a Baptist Church with Charles True and James Hughes. She also visits Seymour Daughters and Sister H gets a sliver in her finger.

entries.fullText:
To Rochester 11 A.M.
Little Harry Rascker [?]
better -- but quite deaf --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony goes to Rochester and Little Harry Rascker is feeling better but quite deaf.

entries.fullText:
at home -- Rochester
X [?] Pea Soup -- excellent --
took some to Maggie --
Sister Hannah siezed [sic] with
violent pain in middle finger of right
hand -- first joint -- got splinter in it
Wednesday -- Sister May sat up
with her all night --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is at home in Rochester and has excellent pea soup. Sister Hannah gets a splinter in her finger and Sister May stays up with her all night.

entries.fullText:
H's finger dreadful -- all the
way up the arm -- felt best to
call Dr Hurd -- no more
splinter could be found --
I sat up with her. She was
not quiet over an hour --
entries.summaryText: Sister H's finger is dreadful and Susan B. Anthony calls Dr. Hurd. She stays up with Sister H but she is not quiet for over an hour.

entries.fullText:
Sister H. grows worse -- every sort
of thing recommended -- but
Dr. Hurd introduced [?] milder
treatment, -- & gave his
medicine rapidly --
entries.summaryText: Sister H. grows worse and Dr. Hurd introduces a milder treatment and gives his medicine rapidly.

entries.fullText:
S.F. Lincoln - stopped
at Lincolns Hotel - had
nice audience. Went
out on the 4.20 train -- Left
Sister H. suffering greatly
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Spencerport and has a nice audience with S.F. Lincoln at Lincoln's Hotel.

entries.fullText:
D Cone - stopped
at the M.S. Ministers - Rev. S. D.
Kingsley [?] - still had fair [?] -
-went out 4.20 train - saw
Maggie & Hannah --H. no
better - hand dreadful
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Adams Basin and meets with D Cone and Rev. S. D. Kingsley. She also sees Maggie and Hannah, but Hannah is still suffering.

entries.fullText:
Brockport - Concert Hall
Johnson Brigham
Mrs Carrie Thomas met me at Depot
& took me home with her - she introduced
me - small audience - 100 -
but the best I ever saw in B.
Little J. R. getting on very [?]
with his measles -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Brockport and performs at the Concert Hall. She is introduced by Mrs. Carrie Thomas and has a small but great audience of 100 people.

entries.fullText:
North Clarkson - Free Will Box [?]
Dewitt [?]
Mr Germain to me to N.C.
rain, snow & mud - terrible
- took awful cold - only 10 men &
3 women at Church -- fearful storm
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits North Clarkson and has a terrible time due to the rain, snow, and mud. She catches a cold and only 10 men and 3 women attend the church due to the storm.

entries.fullText:
North Parma Baptist C.
Charles Efner
Mr. Hane got boy - Montgomery
to carry me across - 5 miles - in
cutter - perfectly awful -
stopped at good old
people - had good audience for
the dreadful roads - took hat drafty
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits North Parma and performs at the Baptist C. She is carried across 5 miles in a cutter by Montgomery due to the awful roads. She has a good audience despite the conditions.

entries.fullText:
Stage at 7.30 to Spencerport &
[?] to Rochester at 10 A.M.
Niece Maggie prostrate with inflamatory
Rheumatism - Sister
Hannah in fearful suffering & myself
feeling unable to stay -took 5 P.M.
train to W. [?] - I stopped at the
Lewis Search - Gruel & hot cornbread
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony leaves Spencerport and Rochester due to her niece Maggie being prostrate with inflammatory rheumatism and her sister Hannah being in fearful suffering. She takes a train to W. and stops at the Lewis Search where she has gruel and hot cornbread.

entries.fullText:
West Henrietta- (Brefletith)(..)
Lewis Pearch,
Fine audience at (B P M) (E F M), - Mr. Dullard took me (1 mile) to his house & Mr. Jones came for me - So had two (..)
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks about her visit to West Henrietta and the audience she had there.

entries.fullText:
Henrietta - Academy Hall
Thomas (heart), Jones
Small audience - Antonette Brown's sister (R..) gave me warm greetings. -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks about her visit to Henrietta and the small audience she had there.

entries.fullText:
Fairfront
Scottsville (G..) Hall -
Rev, Mrs Butler very cordial
fine audience - hardest
hotel bed- added to color
Just about all I can
do to keep going - & then to
feel so many sick ones at home
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks about her visit to Fairfront and the fine audience she had there, despite feeling unwell and worrying about sick people at home.

entries.fullText:
Mumford- Phoenix Hall
M.A. Hyde stopped with
the Hydes warm cordial people-
terrific snow storm all day & my
cold dreadful still there were a
100 people- some drove 8 miles
proof that one must never fail to be on hand
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks about her visit to Mumford and the warm and cordial people she stayed with, despite a snow storm and feeling unwell.

entries.fullText:
North Chili- Chancey Brainerd
Sister H's hand looks as if it must
soon break on the back- was a severe
suffering- Maggie better- [?]
PM her complaining- left on 1:15 train
Methodists Free Church open- by
Claudeuis Brainerd
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks about her visit to North Chili and the suffering of Sister H, as well as the Methodists Free Church open by Claudeuis Brainerd.

entries.fullText:
Churchville- Harfords Hall
V.N. Baclette- P.M.
stopped A. Adis last night- dined this
day at Claudius Brainerds- met
Mrs. Halstead- left at 2 P.M.-
Harfords Hotel- Gruel again
splendid audience-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks about her visit to Churchville and the splendid audience she had there, as well as meeting various people and staying at Harfords Hotel.

entries.fullText:
pouring rain- found sister
H. better- back of hand split
open whole length & discharg is
most free- Brother Aaron left
for Greenwich, last night- Gula
seems feeble- Jenny better
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her journey from Churchville to Rochester, the weather, and the health of her family members.

entries.fullText:
For over two weeks Sister Mary
& Ellen Baker have set up alternate
nights with sister H.
Called on neice Maggie found
her free of our pain but very weak-
- her windy - so dear sister Gula
could not go to see her any
darling Maggie- it is hard, hard-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about visiting her family members and the difficult situation of her niece Maggie's health.

entries.cityOrState: Honeyoye Falls- Stone Church- Wilcox Hotel
entries.fullText:
Honeyoye Falls- Stone Church-
Wilcox Hotel- Calvin Whitney
Deacon of Church- the Sexton
tended door- small audience
roads dreadfully muddy- Left
Rochester at 4 P.M. Train
Hannah better- had a terrible Seige
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to Honeyoye Falls, the weather, and the health of her family member Hannah.

entries.fullText:
East Mendon- Presbyterin Church-
John B. Lovejoy & Dr. P.D. Carpenter-
- Trustees charge $ 10. for church-
perfect gorge- Day took [?] over
5 miles- left ankle lame- mysteriously
- almost blistered it with mustard
paste- then thought what if it was
irreiopelae[?] & not a boil-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to East Mendon and the condition of her ankle.

entries.fullText:
To Rochester- Mr. Lovejoy
took me to Fisher's Station- waited
3 hours- home at 2 P.M.
ankle pretty lames- got off
some 150 complimentary tickets
to working people-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her trip to Rochester and distributing complimentary tickets to working people.

entries.fullText:
Rochester- Corinthian Hall
Ankle very red & lame- all pro-
nounce it irrecipelus- - large audience
1000 - fully - VanVhoores introduced me
Sister Gula not able to go
Guy Piteher went- think [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her speaking engagement at Corinthian Hall in Rochester and the condition of her ankle.

entries.fullText:
Egypt- Cullen Loud-
School house- Wm. Becker
ankle better- but fiery
looking still- no pain in it - only
came when I walk-
small audience
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her ankle and a small audience in Egypt.

entries.fullText:
Mr. Decker took me
to Fairport 3 P.M. train
an hour late- then waited
at freight yard 2 hours-
met Larry Cady- Hattie Cooks
husband- spent evning with us
then went back to Brockett House
to sleep-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Fairport with Mr. Decker and meets Larry Cady and Hattie Cooks.

entries.fullText:
In Rochester
Cady to dinner with
us- Gula very feeble-
fear she is losing ground
every day- Hannah's hand
still fearfully bad- Dr. Hurd
lanced the inside Friday
discharged a tea cup full-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spends time in Rochester with Cady and is concerned about Gula's health and Hannah's hand.

entries.fullText:
Penfield- Academy Hall
Issac Bronson
Hannah's hand better- hope it
will be saved to her- took stage
at 3 P.M.- stopped at Charles Miller
wife Mrs. Clorinda Lee Miller was sharp
dress- rained in eve- very windy
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Penfield and hopes Hannah's hand will be saved. She also stops at Charles Miller's house.

entries.fullText:
East Penfield- School house
[?] wife Baptist Church P. Loonett
stopped at Olney Hill- Dory
drove me over 4 miles deep
mud- began to rain in P.M.
small audience-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits East Penfield and encounters deep mud and a small audience.

entries.fullText:
Webster- Methodist church
Louis Crippin ( O.E. Pratt )
Mr. hill took me over 8
miles - stopped Hotel - Burt
West- his wife wouldn't vote-
Mr. Crippin & daughter took
me home after lecture-
rain just poured all the P.M. and eving-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony gives a lecture in Webster and encounters rain. She also meets Louis Crippin and Mr. hill.

entries.cityOrState:
West Webster- M.E. Church
Hotel ) Charles Goetzman
entries.fullText:
Clear & bright sunshine- Strong
west wind- Dr. Dunning took
me over- splendid audience
James R. Mineyard-
Julia Schermerhorn-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to West Webster and the people she met there.

entries.cityOrState:
Scottsville -lined out- M.E. Church -lined out - John Croft - lined out-
Rochester 8 miles
car buggy- worst old plank
road & mud ever seen- Sister
Hannah's hand better- Gula
weaker- it is dreadful to see a
loved one just sliding down
& no power to stay the disease
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to Scottsville and Rochester and the condition of her loved ones.
Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to Rochester.

entries.cityOrState:
West Rush-- School house
P.M. John B. Bristol
Mr. Nan Buskirk- Trustee-
Small audience-
left Rochester at 4 P.M.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to West Rush and the people she met there.

entries.cityOrState:
Rush- stopped at
Peter Martin- M.E. Church-
Marion Martin refused
to pay taxes last five years
splendid audience
James Hallock
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to Rush and the people she met there.

entries.fullText:
stopped at john Croft-
Van Vhooris' sister & D.P.S. Brown's
wife & children at meeting-
fine audience- terrific
rain before close-
M.E. minister introduced me
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony stopped at John Croft in Scottsville and met with Van Vhooris' sister and D.P.S. Brown's wife and children at a meeting. She had a fine audience and was introduced by the M.E. minister.

entries.fullText:
E.E. Howard
stopped Rev. Serleys
had nice audience
though it rained&
was very muddy-
dined at Mr. Brainards Jr. Chili
& Chaney took me to Clifton -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony had a nice audience despite the rain and mud at a school house in Clifton. She dined at Mr. Brainards Jr. Chili and was taken to Clifton by Chaney.

entries.fullText:
Charlotte- School Hall
F.A. Ambrose
D.Davis- school trustee-
no train at 6-P.M. got telegram
- hired Knowles to take me down
- very muddy- small audience
-Ambrosels breath strong
with whiskey-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke at a small audience at the School Hall in Charlotte. She hired Knowles to take her down after receiving a telegram and noted that F.A. Ambrose's breath was strong with whiskey.

entries.fullText:
Came up to Ro. at 9A.M.
and stopped till 3 P.M.
then went to Fishers & William Cox took me to mentor
- wife a pleasant woman
Mrs. Charlotte W. Cox
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony stopped in Ro. and then went to Fishers where William Cox took her to mentor. She noted that William Cox's wife was a pleasant woman.

entries.fullText:
Mendon Centre- 3 P.M.
Friends Meeting House
William Cox- attended
friends meeting in A.M.- - Had
a large audience at 3.M.
gave Power of the Ballot- went
to Norman B. Davis- James
Halleck & wife called-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke at a large audience at the Friends Meeting House in Mendon Centre and gave a speech on the Power of the Ballot. She also visited Norman B. Davis and was called on by James Halleck and his wife.

entries.fullText:
Irrondequoit- No 3 School House
Gideon Anthony-
Breakfast at 6- Train to Honyoye
Falls at 6.55- waited Rush station
2 hours- Rochester 10.30-
Gideon took his mother Huldah
met with me at 5P.M.- large meeting
& Gide's wife Molly splendid housekeeper
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke at a large meeting at the No 3 School House in Irrondequoit. She met with Gideon Anthony and his mother Huldah and noted that Gide's wife Molly was a splendid housekeeper.

entries.fullText:
Gideon bro't me
home about noon-
Mary house cleaning-
entries.summaryText: Gideon brought me home and Mary was cleaning.

entries.fullText:
Home- chatting
with Sister Gula-
& then mother then
trying to pick up table
and letters & papers
entries.summaryText: Chatted with Sister Gula and mother, then picked up table and letters.

entries.fullText:
Home-
Pa's same
& trying to rest-
entries.summaryText: At home, Pa is resting.

entries.fullText:
Home-
Sister Gula
seemed very much
brighter than for a long
time- oh if it would only
last-
entries.summaryText: At home, Sister Gula seemed brighter than usual.

entries.fullText:
Got bonnet of Miss
Backus- $10. I [?]
just for the ribon & set ornament
& inside lining & face blue silk
- hat very tasteful- yes & a half
yard of spotted lace for hair-
entries.summaryText: Bought a tasteful hat and lace for hair from Miss Backus for $10.

entries.fullText:
In Rochester-
saw Judge Selden & Van
Vhooris yesterday- Marsh & Jones
called in the P.M.- Rev. D.R.
Bartlett also- asked if Beecher
Tilton scandal was true-
entries.summaryText: In Rochester, saw Judge Selden, Van Vhooris, Marsh, Jones, and Rev. D.R. Bartlett. Bartlett asked about the Beecher Tilton scandal.

entries.fullText:
Left for 10 Train - too
late- went to niece Maggies & staid till the 1.15- had a nice
visit with her- children sweet
& mama splendid-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits her niece Maggie.

entries.fullText:
Left Erie at 10 A.M.-
4 P.M. at Mercer- Penn- $75
T.R. Thompson-
Mr. Albin- lawyer
introduced me- fine audience
- Rainy all day- cleared off
in eveing.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Mercer, Pennsylvania and speaks to a fine audience.

entries.fullText:
Took A. by Greater Western R.R.
at Greenville Pa- - It was
a lovely day- Found
Gov. R.E. Fenton on board-
& Miss Champlin of Randolph, N.J.
The Gov. very [?] &
friends to woman's rights-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Greenville, Pennsylvania and meets Governor R.E. Fenton who is supportive of women's rights.

entries.fullText:
New York- arrived 9 A.M.
Lovely day-
Committee, Suffrage meeting at the
Loziers at 2P.M.- Called on
E.C. B. only Mrs. Blak & Miss McAdam
came- eveing called Mrs. Phelps & Mr.
wilbour- Mrs. Lozier good as ever.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a suffrage meeting in New York and visits with various people in the evening.

entries.fullText:
New York- to Tenafly-
rained hard all the day
- reached Mrs. Stanton's 3 P.M.-
Found Mrs. S. bright &
beaming as always-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Tenafly and visits with Mrs. Stanton.

entries.fullText:
Tenafly- Had splendid
sleep last night- The
rain fell again all day-
made points of Prosecution
for Convention- Mrs. Gage
did not come to Tenafly.
Couldn't sleep
for the street car noise-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony prepares for a convention and notes that Mrs. Gage did not come to Tenafly.

entries.fullText:
At Tenafly- Beautiful day-
Wrote & rode out
on Palisades- in P.M.
Mrs. Blake advertised
me to give "Story of my Trial"
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spends a beautiful day in Tenafly, writes and rides out on Palisades, and is advertised by Mrs. Blake to give a "Story of my Trial".

entries.fullText:
Stock Co. meeting 3 P.M.
at Parlor Colman House-
- went into N.J. at 8.30-
Davis, Wright, Phelps, Wilham
the Hallocks & e at meeting-
Mrs. Blake's advertising a failure
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a Stock Co. meeting at Parlor Colman House in N.J. with Davis, Wright, Phelps, Wilham, the Hallocks, and others. Mrs. Blake's advertising is a failure.

entries.fullText:
Anniversary National W.S.A.
Apollo Hall- New York-
- meeting good as could
be with no newspaper advertising
Mrs.Stanton failed to be present
at my lecture [?] she
has never yet heard me give
a lecture-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends the Anniversary National W.S.A. meeting at Apollo Hall in New York. Mrs. Stanton is not present at her lecture.

entries.fullText:
To Orange at 9.40-
Mrs. Wright, Stanton, & self
Dined at Martha Lords- with
Lucretia Mott- probably the
last dinner as well as last
Convention we shall enjoy
with her- now in her 81st year-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Orange with Mrs. Wright and Stanton. They dine at Martha Lords with Lucretia Mott, who is now in her 81st year. It is likely the last dinner and convention they will enjoy with her.

entries.fullText:
Wednesday eving- Mrs. S. & self
returned to a Sociable at
Dr. Loziers- very pleasant-
Desolved into a business meeting
& with other things- re-adopted
our national constitution to
fill the red tape role for Lucy Stones
carping- Dined at E.C. Morris- Julian
there ? with A.E.D. there Stone ?
[?] right- that is Wednesday-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a sociable at Dr. Loziers, which dissolves into a business meeting where they re-adopt their national constitution to fill the red tape role for Lucy Stones' carping. She then dines at E.C. Morris with Julian and A.E.D.

entries.fullText:
Arrived Rochester- 10 A.M.
- Met Selden & Van Vhoorees
at 12 hours- voters & inspectors
& John Vhorees met at D. Anthony's
at evning- talked over suit-
Sister Gula seems a little better.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrives in Rochester and meets with Selden, Van Vhoorees, voters, inspectors, and John Vhorees to talk over a suit. Sister Gula seems a little better.

entries.fullText: Remained at home looking over & answering letters- bright day - at eve called Hallowell - but so few see or feel any special importance in the pending trial
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony remained at home, looked over and answered letters, and called Hallowell. She noted that few people see or feel any special importance in the pending trial.

entries.fullText: Called Mary B.F. Curtis- very serious case- Mrs. Stebbins there-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony called Mary B.F. Curtis and noted a very serious case. Mrs. Stebbins was also present.

entries.fullText: In Rochester bright & beautiful
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony noted that it was bright and beautiful in Rochester.

entries.fullText: Trial of Inspectors & Women Rochester in U.S. District Court A.H. Hall- Judge - Crowley- U.S. District Attorney- all of us 15 women & 3 Inspectors appeared- but no call of either case
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the trial of Inspectors and Women in Rochester's U.S. District Court. A.H. Hall was the judge and Crowley was the U.S. District Attorney. All 15 women and 3 Inspectors appeared, but there was no call of either case.

entries.fullText: Hanging around the U.S. District court but us before [ ? ] our case [?] Dined at Mrs. Leyden with Mrs. Gage
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony hung around the U.S. District court, but their case was not called. She dined at Mrs. Leyden's with Mrs. Gage.

entries.fullText: Women Tax Payers meeting in the Mayor's office [? ] - fine audience of women Sister Gula seems to be losing ground every day-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a Women Tax Payers meeting in the Mayor's office with a fine audience of women. She noted that Sister Gula seems to be losing ground every day.

entries.fullText: MAY MONDAY, 19 1873
Sister G. seemed brighter
entries.summaryText: Sister G. seemed brighter

entries.fullText:
Today from Troy to
New York
Garden
entries.summaryText: Travel from Troy to New York, visited Garden

entries.fullText:
sister Gula spent this
day at Geo. Caldwell has Judge [?]
Crowley moved cases over to
Circuit Court today- all gave
pledge of $400 S.B. & made test case-
all women but sister Gula
present- she too ill-
entries.summaryText: Sister Gula was ill and did not attend the Circuit Court where cases were moved and a test case was made with all women but her present.

entries.fullText:
This day they went to
Mary Ann's South Branch, N.J.
- U.S. District Att. Crowley both women
voters & Inspectors cases to the U.S.
Circuit Court, Canandaigua Ontario Co-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony and U.S. District Att. Crowley took both women voters and inspectors cases to the U.S. Circuit Court in Canandaigua Ontario Co after visiting Mary Ann's in South Branch, N.J.

entries.fullText:
Mr. Glidden pledged
to post bills this P.M. for
next weeks meetings-
entries.summaryText: Mr. Glidden pledged to post bills for next week's meetings.

entries.fullText:
Fishers Station Ontario Co. on 3 P.M.
train- School House- staffed
Geo. W. & Laura A. Hill, the
wifes mother- Laura A. Woolston
small meeting almost no notice
The Carpenters began repairing
no [F ?] eat Parlor dining room door
into Gula's bedroom
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a small meeting in Fishers Station Ontario Co. and the Carpenters began repairing a door into Gula's bedroom.

entries.fullText:
Victor- Union Hall-
Hotel- L.D. Coville-
went Rochester & staid till the
7 P.M. train- Mr Lewis
introduced me- Mr A.L.
Peat- of old A.S. Times present
small audience-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony went to Victor and attended a small meeting at Union Hall and stayed at a hotel. She went to Rochester and was introduced by Mr. Lewis to Mr A.L. Peat of old A.S. Times who was present in a small audience.

entries.fullText:
Clifton Springs-
A.M. train to Canandaigua-
made contract for Posters & advertising
meetings & reached Clifton Springs 3 P.M.
- no arrangements made- Dr. Foster
neglected it- Ladies called me to
Parlor- & I talked to them few minutes
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrived at Clifton Springs and made a contract for posters and advertising.

entries.fullText:
Phelps
Mercer Penn
F.A. Thompson
Hall- Lucius Howe-
arrived 10 A.M. - dined at
Cousin Almira Dushnells-
called on Cousin Susan Biddleion
& back at 4 & took nap til 7- had
small audience
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visited Phelps and met with F.A. Thompson and Lucius Howe.

entries.fullText:
East Bloomfield in Bradley Hall
Stopped Dr. C. Eastman
Principal Academy- Mrs. Gage
joined on re Canandaigua- next
into Rochester at 11 & out at 3-
& fine audience-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke at Bradley Hall in East Bloomfield and met with Dr. C. Eastman and Mrs. Gage.

entries.fullText:
West Farmington spoke in
dining room of P. Waterman
Smith- fine audience-
Cousin Jo. Hathaway met me
at Depot & took me over four
miles or so- full 8 [? 20]
went to Clifton with Mis Gage- then
into Ro. 12- & out on 7 train-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke at P. Waterman Smith's dining room in West Farmington and met with Cousin Jo. Hathaway and Mis Gage.

entries.fullText:
Farmington- Punkin Hook-
Orthodox Friends Meeting House-
Cousin Jo. & wife & Cousin Han-
nah Lafhorn Hathaway- took me
over- large audience & good
Listeners-
entries.summaryText:
Susan B. Anthony spoke at the Orthodox Friends Meeting House in Punkin Hook, Farmington and was accompanied by Cousin Jo. and Cousin Han-
nah Lafhorn Hathaway.

entries.fullText:
Manchester- Basement
of Baptist Church- Mr. F.L.
Brown- Lawyer of Shortsville = took
me over & back to S.- sultry & the
people packed like sardines-
stopped @ Wm Livingston Browns-
Mrs Leonard Clairvoyant later then-
went in to Rochester out 9 A.M. &
back to S. on 5 P.M. train-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke at the basement of the Baptist Church in Manchester and met with Mr. F.L. Brown, Wm Livingston Browns, and Mrs Leonard.

entries.fullText:
spoke in New Hall- crowded-
went up to Canandaigua at 1 05
back at 3- dined at F.L.B's-
stopped at Wm Livingston Browns
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke in a crowded New Hall and then went to Canandaigua and dined at F.L.B's and stopped at Wm Livingston Browns.

entries.fullText:
- Methodist
Church- stopped at James
L. Munsons- daughter taking vocal lessons
of Prof. [ ? Appz ]- large audience
& threatens rain- but didn't come
Beautiful moonlight evenings-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a large audience at the Methodist Church and stopped at James L. Munsons where his daughter was taking vocal lessons.

entries.fullText:
- went Rochester 8.20-
found more cheery letter from Sister
Gula- do hope such mad my countr ??
- Paperers & Painters still at
work on the Parlors- back to
Phelps at 5- tea-& cousin Lucius
carried me to Orleans- 5 miles-
Methodist Church- full-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony went to Rochester and received a cheery letter from Sister Gula. She went back to Phelps and had tea with cousin Lucius and went to the full Methodist Church in Orleans.

entries.fullText:
- School House-
Mr Edward Holmes- The Pres.
Trustees refused Church- the [? only ]
place at Corners- so were 3/4 mile
out to School House- heavy shower-
- but quite a little gathering -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony went to a School House where Mr Edward Holmes spoke because the Pres. Trustees refused Church at Corners.

entries.fullText:
Geneva Universalist Church
Charles A. Miller
Arrived at 10 A.M.- found
C.D. Miller & son Willie at Depot.
their home on west bank of Geneva
lake parfaits delightful- Norma's
quite ill- Quincey- had splendid
audience-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the Geneva Universalist Church and visited Charles A. Miller. She also visited C.D. Miller and son Willie at the Depot and their home on the west bank of Geneva lake. Norma was quite ill and Quincey had a splendid audience.

entries.fullText:
2 P.M.-
- Geneva to Phelps 10 A.M. - Cousin
Lucius took me to Clifton- to Mrs. Pecks- packed house- new
Montgorney of Rochester first-
went park house & slept at
Cousin Le. Havens
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony went from Geneva to Phelps with Cousin Lucius and visited a packed house at Mrs. Pecks in Clifton. She also went to the park house and slept at Cousin Le. Havens.

entries.fullText: Phelps to Rochester, back to Gorham arrived just 8- dressed & in pulpit by 8:30~packed house going west away_ found Mother quite poorly with cold & asthma - word from .....still hopeful 5 miles to
entries.summaryText: Phelps to Rochester, back to Gorham arrived just 8- dressed & in pulpit by 8:30~packed house going west away_ found Mother quite poorly with cold & asthma - word from .....still hopeful 5 miles to

entries.fullText:
Staffed hotel- Mr. Davis took me to church and back- small audience- the much needed rain came in torrents- Miss Addis Cook took me from G. to Re. Corners wrote ten letters in B.M. was never so stupid as to actually gap while speaking till to night.
9 miles to Rushville.
entries.summaryText: Staffed hotel- Mr. Davis took me to church and back- small audience- the much needed rain came in torrents- Miss Addis Cook took me from G. to Re. Corners wrote ten letters in B.M. was never so stupid as to actually gap while speaking till to night.

entries.fullText: Stopped Hotel- wrote ten letters again- Mrs. Harrington- R.R. Contractor- called on home- cold water wash, immense jam- only $9.30 collection- It is the last free admission- Self respect forbids- A.E. Beers Photographer introduced me-
entries.summaryText: Stopped Hotel- wrote ten letters again- Mrs. Harrington- R.R. Contractor- called on home- cold water wash, immense jam- only $9.30 collection- It is the last free admission- Self respect forbids- A.E. Beers Photographer introduced me-

entries.fullText: Halls Corners - School House Marion Nichols & George Nichols- the merchants there- not a living soul interested- not one woman spoke to me at close of lecture ( ? )packed house- Mr. Beers took me over from Rushville- his daughter left husband- learned Milliners trade
entries.summaryText: Halls Corners - School House Marion Nichols & George Nichols- the merchants there- not a living soul interested- not one woman spoke to me at close of lecture ( ? )packed house- Mr. Beers took me over from Rushville- his daughter left husband- learned Milliners trade

entries.cityOrState: Stanley- School House Thomas M. Gauley
entries.fullText:
Stanley- School House Thomas M. Gauley-
took 9 train to Canandaigua Hotel Mrs Gage there- town hall too dirty to get into- returned Stanley
3 P.M.- went up & down & across from house to house to get place to stay-& at last called at largest brick house in desperation- Mrs. M.Carly said she would not- rather humiliating
entries.summaryText:
Stanley- School House Thomas M. Gauley-
took 9 train to Canandaigua Hotel Mrs Gage there- town hall too dirty to get into- returned Stanley
3 P.M.- went up & down & across from house to house to get place to stay-& at last called at largest brick house in desperation- Mrs. M.Carly said she would not- rather humiliating

entries.fullText: 9 train to Canandaigua- tried to get Presbyterian & Congregational Church- so stick to Town Hall- to Rochester 12 noon- in Moores with sisters H. then Depot 520- Lewis Station 7.25 -- little girl Mary McCorty me me Depot- large audience again
entries.summaryText: 9 train to Canandaigua- tried to get Presbyterian & Congregational Church- so stick to Town Hall- to Rochester 12 noon- in Moores with sisters H. then Depot 520- Lewis Station 7.25 -- little girl Mary McCorty me me Depot- large audience again

entries.fullText: Left Mrs. Whitney Lewis at 9.5 & reached C. Depot at 9:50- just 7 miles in 45 minutes- most .... seeing- Whitney Lewis drove me over- Mother better- Victoria C. Wood very ill- hope she will live to justify herself & statements-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony left Whitney Lewis and arrived at C. Depot, where she mentioned her mother's health and Victoria C. Wood's illness.

entries.fullText:
Canandaigua- U.S. Coune tion
Mother very bad- coughed till 2 A.M.- Left on 10 Train-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was in Canandaigua for a U.S. Coune tion and mentioned her mother's health.

entries.fullText:
U.S. Circuit Court- Mr.
Justice Hunt- Mrs. Gage & self
at C. Prowley moved my case at 2-
Judge Selden made argument-
Sister Hannah Cu[?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the U.S. Circuit Court in Canandaigua with Mr. Justice Hunt and Mrs. Gage, and mentioned Sister Hannah Cu[?].

entries.fullText:
Circuit Court-
Judge Hunt refused Jedge S. to
address Jury & instructed Jury to
bring in verdict of guilty--refused
to poll jury- Defendents convicted
& has [ Seharis ] denied address to jury-
The greatest outrage History ever witnessed-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the Circuit Court where Judge Hunt refused Judge S. to address the Jury and instructed them to bring in a verdict of guilty, which she called the greatest outrage in history.

entries.fullText:
Mrs. Hebbard,Mosher, Leyden,
Anthony,Pulver came down to Court
- new trial moved by both Selden & [ Hunt ]
--hearing at 2.P.M.- Masterly Note
[ ???] of cause by both S. & V.- Judge
H.denied my case at once- deferred
Inspectors till morning- Att. moved my [??]
- Judge asked reason why [???] should
[ ???] I answered I have much to say-
a [?] silence reigned in court
while I declared every right stricken down-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended court with Mrs. Hebbard, Mosher, Leyden, Anthony, Pulver, Selden, and Hunt. A new trial was moved by both Selden and Hunt, and Susan B. Anthony declared every right stricken down.

entries.fullText:
Mrs. Gage went home- & so did I-
but Friday A.M. found me in Court
again, bound to stand by & see the
Inspectors through. [ The ] pleas
clear unanswerable- but no
law, largis or justice could change his
will- we were convicted before hearing
& all trial a mere farce
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony and Mrs. Gage went home, but Susan B. Anthony found herself back in court on Friday morning. The pleas were clear and unanswerable, but they were convicted before hearing and the trial was a mere farce.

entries.dateText:
Maggie & George gone to the [?] yesterday
& today- Mary at No 7- Little T.R. at 30- sent for them this P.M.- sweet little fellow
June Saturday, 21 1873
entries.fullText:
Maggie & George gone to the [?] yesterday
& today- Mary at No 7- Little T.R. at 30- sent for them this P.M.- sweet little fellow
June Saturday, 21 1873
entries.summaryText: Maggie, George, Mary, and Little T.R. were mentioned in the entry.

entries.dateText:
At home- No 7 - all day-

Gula seems very feeble- really
no gain- but rather loss- weighs
only 96 lbs- against 100 6 weeks ago-
she is delighted with the repairs of
house- indeed , parlor & all are my [?]
M.H. Hallowell called - & several others
-Maggie returned at 6P.M.-
entries.fullText:
At home- No 7 - all day-

Gula seems very feeble- really
no gain- but rather loss- weighs
only 96 lbs- against 100 6 weeks ago-
she is delighted with the repairs of
house- indeed , parlor & all are my [?]
M.H. Hallowell called - & several others
-Maggie returned at 6P.M.-
entries.summaryText: Gula's health was discussed, as well as the repairs of the house. M.H. Hallowell and Maggie were mentioned in the entry.

entries.dateText:
Sunday, 22
Aaron took Harry home-
Gula had bad night- Maggie, George
called in P.M.- also J. Sacket &
wife, Mary & Minnie- C.F. Stebbins
& Sarah Owens, W.R. & M.H. Hallowell
entries.fullText:
Sunday, 22
Aaron took Harry home-
Gula had bad night- Maggie, George
called in P.M.- also J. Sacket &
wife, Mary & Minnie- C.F. Stebbins
& Sarah Owens, W.R. & M.H. Hallowell
entries.summaryText: Aaron, Harry, Gula, Maggie, George, J. Sacket, Mary, Minnie, C.F. Stebbins, Sarah Owens, W.R., and M.H. Hallowell were mentioned in the entry.

entries.dateText:
Monday, 23
Left Rochester at 10:30 A.M.
Brockton 3.20 & reached Oil City
8.30 & Franklin 9.30 P.M.-
Staffed at Exchange Hotel.
entries.fullText:
Monday, 23
Left Rochester at 10:30 A.M.
Brockton 3.20 & reached Oil City
8.30 & Franklin 9.30 P.M.-
Staffed at Exchange Hotel.
entries.summaryText: The author traveled from Rochester to Oil City and stayed at the Exchange Hotel.

entries.dateText:
June Tuesday, 24 1873
Franklin.Penn- &75
City Hall- R.G. Lambertson
Exchange Hotel-
Mr. Lovil Richardson- ex mayor
of Rochester- called- last all
in Oil- Mr. R. at day's work at [?]
Oil City- Good audience-
entries.fullText:
June Tuesday, 24 1873
Franklin.Penn- &75
City Hall- R.G. Lambertson
Exchange Hotel-
Mr. Lovil Richardson- ex mayor
of Rochester- called- last all
in Oil- Mr. R. at day's work at [?]
Oil City- Good audience-
entries.summaryText: The author was in Franklin and Oil City. R.G. Lambertson and Lovil Richardson were mentioned in the entry.

entries.dateText:
Wednesday, 25
Oil City- Daniel L. Jack
Opera House- St. Charles Hotel
small audience-
took ride to an oil field
with Mr. Lamberton- & then
lunched with Mrs. Richardson
- Mrs. Warren & Mrs. Grant there
entries.fullText:
Wednesday, 25
Oil City- Daniel L. Jack
Opera House- St. Charles Hotel
small audience-
took ride to an oil field
with Mr. Lamberton- & then
lunched with Mrs. Richardson
- Mrs. Warren & Mrs. Grant there
entries.summaryText: The author was in Oil City and went to the Opera House and St. Charles Hotel. Daniel L. Jack, Mr. Lamberton, Mrs. Richardson, Mrs. Warren, and Mrs. Grant were mentioned in the entry.

entries.dateText:
Thursday, 26
Left Oil City at 10.50
lunched on Strawberry & milk at
3.20 at Brockton- home 9 P.M.
Sister Gula seemed a little
better- but scarred peruftible
was awful tired
entries.fullText:
Thursday, 26
Left Oil City at 10.50
lunched on Strawberry & milk at
3.20 at Brockton- home 9 P.M.
Sister Gula seemed a little
better- but scarred peruftible
was awful tired
entries.summaryText: The author left Oil City and had lunch in Brockton. Gula's health was discussed.

entries.fullText:
Gula seemed better
better appetite-
Mary & self with Mrs. [?]
Stebbins, Pulver & Hubbard
went to Pittsford to [?]
Mrs. Stebbins presented [?]
to President Grant to appoint
Hon Henry R. Selden- Chief
Justice of U.S. Supreme Court
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony and others went to Pittsford where Mrs. Stebbins presented someone to President Grant to appoint Hon Henry R. Selden as Chief Justice of U.S. Supreme Court.

entries.fullText:
Never got home until
2 o clock A.M. Cars late-
swell meeting-
Gula seemed quite
like herself to day-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a swell meeting and arrived home late.

entries.fullText:
Gula seems brighter- we
really almost hope- Aaron
went to Church-
Mrs. Willis called at
evening & sat an hour
by Gula-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony and Aaron went to church. Mrs. Willis visited Gula in the evening.

entries.fullText:
Gula had bad night-
coughed a great deal- & looks
very badly today- Mrs. [?]
took her after Mrs. Wilks & she
rubbed her & quieted her
a good deal- it would be
wonderful if she could do
more for her than all the doctors
Mrs. Willard[?] here at [?] P.M.
entries.summaryText: Gula had a bad night and coughed a lot. Mrs. Wilks helped her feel better. Mrs. Willard visited in the evening.

entries.fullText:
Sister Gula had better night
-slept down in bedroom for the first-
- she is 55 years old today-
Maggie came to tea-
not a letter to day- ( Mrs.Stanton has
not written since trial- ) worked at
[?] reports & comments on trial
in little book- called any parts
Sister Gula weighed up 92 lbs-
entries.summaryText: Gula had a better night and slept in the bedroom for the first time. Maggie came to tea. Susan B. Anthony worked on reports and comments on the trial in a little book.

entries.fullText:
Mrs. Willis cannot
come to Sister Gula any
more- will try to take
her to her house- she
has better appetite
Mrs. Lozier & Mrs. Blake
hold indignation meeting
in N.J. this day-
entries.summaryText: Mrs. Willis cannot come to visit Gula anymore. Mrs. Lozier and Mrs. Blake hold an indignation meeting in N.J.

entries.fullText:
Weedsport- open air
Shurtleff
Mrs. Carrie Weed Putnam
Ms Charles Covell- Elmira New York
rained till noon- took 6 A.M.
train- 1000 or more people- here
at 10 P.M.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her day in Weedsport, where she met with Shurtleff, Mrs. Carrie Weed Putnam, and Ms Charles Covell from Elmira New York. It rained until noon and there were 1000 or more people there.

entries.fullText:
Gula & Aaron went to
Batavia at 10 A.M.- Lovely
day- letter from Mrs.
Blake of their Indignation
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about Gula and Aaron going to Batavia and receiving a letter from Mrs. Blake expressing their indignation.

entries.fullText:
Gula & Aaron at Batavia
called at Hallowells
to tea- met Mrs. Anne
Davis & her sister Alice
Mother has ney ? Carrie
back-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about Gula and Aaron visiting Hallowells and meeting Mrs. Anne Davis and her sister Alice. She also mentions that Mother has ney ? Carrie back.

entries.fullText:
Gula & Aaron returned
at 10 A.M.- very, very,
feeble- seemed to have lost
in the two days- I called
at Dr. Moore's with sister H.
her hand healing- Sister Gula
went to Mrs. Issac Willis at 7
P.M.- I put her in bed & left her-
hoping against hope- that half might come
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about Gula and Aaron returning and Gula feeling very feeble. She also mentions visiting Dr. Moore with sister H and Gula going to Mrs. Issac Willis. She ends with a hopeful note.

entries.fullText:
Letter with call for indig-
nation meeting from Mrs. Gage-
wrote letters to friends-
Gula slept quite well in her
new quarters-& has enjoyed
herself to day there- so
reports Aaron. he is the only
one who has caled there-

meeting in N.Jersey
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about receiving a letter with a call for an indignation meeting from Mrs. Gage and writing letters to friends. She also mentions Gula sleeping well and enjoying herself in her new quarters and a meeting in N.Jersey.

entries.fullText:
Sister Gula took a bath
+ seemed to feel pretty bright after it
entries.summaryText: Sister Gula takes a bath and feels better.

entries.fullText:
Attended tax-payers
meeting - quite rainy- Judge
Selden not ready to speak-
entries.summaryText: Attends a tax-payers meeting, Judge Selden not ready to speak.

entries.fullText:
Called on Sister Gula
at Mrs. Willis'- she is very,very
feeble- Mr. Brown- special
of N.Y. Herald called-
It did seem that I could
not leave her there at
night to sleep alone upstairs.
but she is full of cough
entries.summaryText: Visits Sister Gula at Mrs. Willis' and meets Mr. Brown from the N.Y. Herald.

entries.fullText:
Sister Hannah had hand cut
again this A.M. & put seaton in-
then called Willis & Gula bright, had
better night last night & less cough
entries.summaryText: Sister Hannah has a cut on her hand, calls Willis and Gula who had a better night.

entries.fullText:
Sister Gula came
home this P.M.- nothing
gained- it is down, down
entries.summaryText: Sister Gula comes home with no improvement.

entries.fullText:
[*Hannahs cut from end of finger to palm
she took ether*]
entries.summaryText: Hannah injured her finger and took ether.

entries.fullText:
Aunt Sarah & Hannah
Perine - now Todd and
Burnham dined with us -
-went Depot with Aunt Sarah
- called & took tea at May
Curtis' - then called Aunt [?] -
May Curtis very feeble
entries.summaryText: Aunt Sarah, Hannah, Perine, Todd, Burnham, and May Curtis visited and had dinner together.

entries.fullText:
25th Anniversary of first Women's
Rights Convention - Seneca Falls, N.Y.
[?] & Mrs. Stanton called it -
entries.summaryText: The 25th anniversary of the first Women's Rights Convention in Seneca Falls, NY was celebrated and visited by [?] and Mrs. Stanton.

entries.fullText:
Dined at Niece Maggies
Then Maggie, little J.K.
came home with me - J.K.[?]
very [?] -, after he got home
had tremendous gush of dirrahea
- I went down & left them -
but he returned later - it must
have been a sudden chill-
entries.summaryText: The author dined with her niece Maggie and later took Maggie's child, J.K., home with her. J.K. became ill with diarrhea, but later returned home.

entries.fullText:
Dr Moore called to see Sister
[?] - Said the apex of both lung
areas diseased - but lower portions of
both are sound
Good letter from brother J.R.
sending passes & urging Gula & Aaron to
go west- -
go over -
entries.summaryText: Dr. Moore visits Sister and provides a medical diagnosis. Brother J.R. sends passes and urges Gula and Aaron to go west.

entries.fullText:
Dr Moore called to see Sister
[?] - Said the apex of both lung
areas diseased - but lower portions of
both are sound
Good letter from brother J.R.
sending passes & urging Gula & Aaron to
go west- -
go over -
entries.summaryText: Dr. Moore visits Sister and provides a medical diagnosis. Brother J.R. sends passes and urges Gula and Aaron to go west.

entries.fullText:
Tax Payers meeting - Rev Miller
Miller spoke very [ ? baffels]
Pol [?] made short speech
entries.summaryText: Rev. Miller speaks at a Tax Payers meeting and Pol makes a short speech.

entries.fullText:
[?] Brother [?]
came on 10 P.M. train
entries.summaryText: Brother [?] arrives on the 10 P.M. train.

entries.fullText:
Sister had severe attack
of dirrahea - & was very
weak from it - the children
& Maggie came back with Aaron
& 8 - Gula's cough was less
frequent - so she slept [?] this
lovely night -
entries.summaryText: Sister had severe attack of diarrhea and Gula's cough was less frequent.

entries.fullText:
Gula had one of
her brightest days - result
of better sleep
Aaron [J?] & Eugene
went to lower Falls
entries.summaryText: Gula had one of her brightest days.

entries.fullText:
Aaron & Dewitt drove to
Spencerport in A.M. - dined at
Maggies at 2 - then brought
round carrige & took Gula
to Mt. Hope - [?][?]
was at hand riding one & Gula,
came back very tired - Dewitt
left on 9 P.M. train

[*Maggie & George & children went to
Clifton - they got full & [?][?]*]
entries.summaryText: Aaron and Dewitt took Gula to Mt. Hope and Dewitt left on 9 P.M. train.

entries.fullText:
Sister Mary went to the
Lake with Mrs. Judson & her
husband Stevens - Aaron & Gula
took a ride with Grey horse at
2 P.M. - at 5 returned & Wendall & I
drove back to stable - & I took tea
at Hollowells with F. Douglas, Mrs. Dole
Miss Gleason, Pennypaker & Carson - &
Avery Port
entries.summaryText: Sister Mary went to the Lake and Aaron and Gula took a ride with Grey horse.

entries.fullText:
Dr Moore called on
Gula again - left Tonic
of Camomile
entries.summaryText: Dr Moore called on Gula again and left Tonic of Camomile.

entries.fullText:
Dr. C. H. Starr of [?]
called - sure his medicine
Eureka will cure Sister Gula-
- got large bottle of it - G.H. and
one of [? linnement] [?] - I had
$5 and Aaron $2.50
Gula suffers from [?biles ]
since last Tuesday night
entries.summaryText: Dr. C. H. Starr of [?] called and got a large bottle of Eureka for Gula.

entries.fullText:
very warm, Gula & Aaron
rode out at 10.30-
Sister Mary took tea at
Frank Woolcotts- Mr. W a
great sufferer from sickness from
vaccine- thou years ago- [?]
been Uncle Linee
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about a warm day where she and others rode out and Sister Mary took tea at Frank Woolcotts.

entries.fullText:
Cool & showery-
Gula not quite as strong as a
week ago- but cheery-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about a cool and showery day and notes that Gula is not as strong as she was a week ago, but is still cheery.

entries.fullText:
Mother & self rode
with Sister Gula- Mr
Knowles Hack- newspaper
Telegram tells of Mr & Mrs
Warren badly hurt on Hudson
R.R.R. near Tarrytown- fear
it is Mary Caldwell-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about riding with her mother and Sister Gula and reading a newspaper article about Mr. and Mrs. Warren being badly hurt on the Hudson Railroad near Tarrytown, and fears it is Mary Caldwell.

entries.fullText:
Aaron got N.Y. Tribune
from Geo. Caldwell with details
of the accident- I wrote
cousin Eleanor this P.M.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about Aaron getting the New York Tribune with details about an accident and her writing to cousin Eleanor.

entries.fullText:
Letter from George
Caldwell- Mary Caldwell
pretty badly hurt- feared
fatally
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about receiving a letter from George Caldwell informing her that Mary Caldwell is pretty badly hurt and feared fatally.

entries.fullText:
Women Tax Payers meeting-
Rev. M. Copland of Alexander at
M.E. Church- On way to meeting
called Dr. Moore's he said Sister
Gula's was a case of hopeless consumption
& nothing could cure- simply releine-
I - all of us- had felt & feared
it- since no medicine since last
November has ever seemed to to work, any lasting good to her
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about attending a Women Tax Payers meeting and visiting Dr. Moore, who said that Sister Gula's case of consumption was hopeless and nothing could cure it.

entries.fullText:
Gula seems brighter- Sarah
Willis Sat an hour with her
in front yard- I swept parlors &
bedroom with Mary [?] help-
entries.summaryText: Gula seems brighter and Sarah and Willis visit.

entries.fullText:
Gula had had my
& seems more tired & suffer
today- Maggie here two hours
in the P.M.
Mary B. Fish Curtis died at 11.30 A.M. of
Bright kidney disease- a great sufferer
since last December - she was one who
tried to register in 1st ward last November
entries.summaryText: Gula is suffering and Mary B. Fish Curtis dies.

entries.fullText:
Lovely, quiet, cool, day- Sister
Gula symptoms of dysentery- bloody-
very feeble- appetite sharper - but
fears to eat lest she aggravate the
new danger-

Gula took Dr. Moores Cough
medicine & slept better-
entries.summaryText: Gula is suffering from dysentery and takes Dr. Moores Cough medicine.

entries.fullText:
Funeral of Mary B.F. Curtis
at 3 P.M.- Unitarian Church- Sisters
H. & M. & self all attended- Sister Gula
left at home to think- perhaps herself
might be the next called to go home-
Maggie staid with Sister G. and she
talked of things she would like done
after she was gone-
entries.summaryText: Funeral of Mary B.F. Curtis at Unitarian Church.

entries.fullText:
Sister seemed brighter- had
better sleep- Dr. Moore
called at noon- told her, what
I knew that her Cough remedy had
opium in it- she had Dysenterie
alarrm again- but Dr. M. assured
her that it was not- in the P.M.
I called at Curtis- had long visit with
Sarah Owen
entries.summaryText: Sister's health improves, visit from Dr. Moore and Sarah Owen.

entries.fullText:
x cold- Maggie & Dory went
to Batavia- Giles & Catharine
Stebbins called- Letter from Mrs.
Stanton- Woman's Journal gives list of
all the W.A. women who have wisely worked
& neither Stanton, Anthony, Hooker, Olympia Brown
was among them-
entries.summaryText: Maggie and Dory go to Batavia, letter from Mrs. Stanton, and list of W.A. women in Woman's Journal.

entries.fullText:
Maggie's husband George
had attack Inflammation Bowels
Letter from Sister Annie to Hannah
telling of all the cunning things of the little
ones - Maud, Dannie & Susie
entries.summaryText: Maggie's husband George had an attack of inflammation of the bowels. Sister Annie wrote a letter to Hannah telling of all the cunning things of the little ones - Maud, Dannie & Susie.

entries.fullText:
Letter from D.R. saying he
has tickets to take sister Hannah
out to Leavenworth & back - but Sister
Gula is too feeble for H or any of us
to leave home
entries.summaryText: D.R. wrote a letter saying he has tickets to take sister Hannah out to Leavenworth & back, but Sister Gula is too feeble for H or any of them to leave home.

entries.fullText:
Hannah Frank & Wendel
went to Sodus - Maggie &
Harry called with Carrie for
Grandma McLean to ride at
9 .P.M - I went along
entries.summaryText: Hannah, Frank, and Wendel went to Sodus. Maggie and Harry called with Carrie for Grandma McLean to ride at 9 P.M. Susan B. Anthony went along.

entries.fullText:
Cool but bright, beautiful
Aaron to church - Gula up at 11.
Maggie came up in P.M. -
little T.H. caught hold of hot
poker & burned his hands, both
of them
entries.summaryText: Cool but bright, beautiful day. Aaron went to church. Gula was up at 11 A.M. Maggie came up in the afternoon. Little T.H. caught hold of a hot poker and burned both of his hands.

entries.fullText:
Rainy day & cold - Gula
seems very feeble - less & less
interest in any thing - letter
from Lydia Mott
entries.summaryText: Rainy day and cold. Gula seems very feeble and has less and less interest in anything. Susan B. Anthony received a letter from Lydia Mott.

entries.fullText:
Letter from Gerrit Smith
with $100 check in it
raining & cloudy all A.M.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony received a letter from Gerrit Smith with a $100 check in it. It was raining and cloudy all morning.

entries.fullText:
Gula felt uncommomly
bright in P.M.- Dr. Moore
called- Aunt Sophia
McLean spent day- G.S.
took ride with Maggie, George
and children at 3 P.M.
Harvey Mosher & wife came to Hannah's
entries.summaryText: Gula felt bright in the afternoon and spent time with Dr. Moore, Aunt Sophia McLean, Maggie, George, Harvey Mosher and his wife.

entries.fullText:
Gula had very good day-
Women Tax-Payers meeting
John Van Vhooris- the speaker
good meeting- good legal statement of
Judge Hunts errors- Letter read
from Gerrit Smith- resolution
adopted on death of Mary Curtis
Sister Hannah had fingers straitened
by Dr. Moore- took ether-
entries.summaryText: Gula attended a Women Tax-Payers meeting where John Van Vhooris spoke and there was a good legal statement of Judge Hunts errors. A letter was read from Gerrit Smith and a resolution was adopted on the death of Mary Curtis. Sister Hannah had her fingers straightened by Dr. Moore.

entries.fullText:
Sister Gula had quiet sleep
last night- but a most weary
day- took ride in single buggy
with Aaron- but it tired her
dreadfully-- sent off reports of
yesterdays meeting- some 30 copies
entries.summaryText: Sister Gula had a quiet sleep but a very weary day. She took a ride with Aaron but it tired her. She sent off reports of yesterday's meeting.

entries.fullText:
Sister H. went to Dr.
Moore- he thinks he can
save use of her hand-
entries.summaryText: Sister H. went to Dr. Moore who thinks he can save the use of her hand.

entries.fullText:
Went to Dr. Moores with sister
H.- not in- came over at 4
P.M.- tied finger down- very
painful- dreadful agony
entries.summaryText: Went to Dr. Moore's with Sister H. but he was not in. He came over at 4 PM and tied her finger down, causing a lot of pain and agony.

entries.fullText:
Terrible rape on St Paul
st last night- went for
Amy Port to go with me to
Police Court- couldn't go-
then to C. F. Stebbins- we went
Mayor's office- women must
take hold of the work of
being present at every womans trial
entries.summaryText: There was a terrible rape on St. Paul street last night. Went to get Amy Port to go with me to Police Court but she couldn't go. Then went to C. F. Stebbins and we went to the Mayor's office where it was discussed that women must take hold of the work of being present at every woman's trial.

entries.fullText:
Rainy A.M.-
Wednesday, 27
Beautiful day- Gula
walked across street & down to Park
& back this P.M. very weak- Mrs.
Blackford dined- Mrs. [?] Porter
called- Mrs. C. H. Lands to tea &
took 10 train for west- H's finger
tied clear down to touch hollow
of hand- & kept it so till 1 Thursday A.M.
entries.summaryText: Gula is weak and walks to the park. Mrs. Blackford dined and Mrs. [?] Porter called. Mrs. C. H. Lands visited and took the 10 train for the west. H's finger is tied down.

entries.fullText:
Lovely day- Gideon Anthony
took Mother, Mrs Harris & her Mother
Mrs Simmons & Mrs. Kirkpatrick
& her mother Mrs Turner, to his house
Irondequoit & spent day- Huldah &
Marie there- Gula very much
brighter & better relish for food- rode
out with Maggie- Hannah's finger not
in bandage today- papered her front [?]
entries.summaryText: Gideon Anthony takes family members to his house in Irondequoit. Gula is better and rode out with Maggie. Hannah's finger is not in a bandage.

entries.fullText:
Letter from Mrs. Gage
she is going to thousand Islands
to recruit-
entries.summaryText: Mrs. Gage is going to Thousand Islands to recruit.

entries.fullText:
Gula seems brighter
Letter four P.P.- Sister
May & Lottie Anthony drove
Aaron to Gideons in P.M.
Dr. Moore called- gave prescription
for dirrahea- mostly opium-
- I cannot like the [?]
system-
entries.summaryText: Gula is brighter. Sister May and Lottie Anthony visit. Dr. Moore prescribes opium for diarrhea.

entries.fullText:
Cloud & some rainy
Rhoda DeGarmo very ill-
Maggie, George & children up to
dinner with us- Gula coughs
much less- but tendency to Dirrehea
entries.summaryText: Rhoda DeGarmo is very ill. Maggie, George, and children visit for dinner. Gula coughs less but has a tendency for diarrhea.

entries.fullText:
Gula seems brighter
& better appetite-
I spent A.M. with Mrs. L.C.
Smith negotiating for two columns
in the Weekly Express- called
at Amy Ports, Willis, & Mrs. Smiths-
entries.summaryText: Negotiating for two columns in the Weekly Express with Mrs. L.C. Smith.

entries.fullText:
Pleasant day- Gula
rode out at 10 A.M. with
Knowles- Aaron & Mother with her-
Dreamed last night of sitting at
table & talking with Mary Curtis- all
perfectly natural--
entries.summaryText: Gula rode out with Knowles and dreamed of talking with Mary Curtis.

entries.fullText:
Women Tax Payers meeting
Alderman J.H. Kelly invited to speak
Rained in P.M.- good
little meeting- went home with
M. Hallowell-
entries.summaryText: Attended Women Tax Payers meeting and went home with M. Hallowell.

entries.fullText:
Antoinette Brown Blackwell
called & took dinner- here
home to her mothers funeral-
called with her at Hallowells & then
to Erie Depot- 4 P.M. Train-
had very pleasant call- Gula,
Aaron & Mother rode in A.M.
entries.summaryText: Antoinette Brown Blackwell called and took dinner, then went to her mother's funeral and took the 4 P.M. train from Erie Depot.

entries.fullText:
Telegram of death
of James Bushnell of
Phelps- 83 years old
husband of cousin
Almira Howe- she was his 3rd wife-
entries.summaryText: Received a telegram of the death of James Bushnell, husband of cousin Almira Howe.

entries.fullText: Cold & rainy
entries.summaryText: Cold and rainy day.

entries.fullText: At 3 P. Mother & self took cars for Phelps- at Clifton ran off the track & took carriage to cousin - Lucius Howes
entries.summaryText: Traveled to Phelps and Clifton to visit cousin Lucius Howes.

entries.fullText: Phelps-Funeral of James Bushnell- husband of Cousin Elmira Howe - lived at Stotenburgs- the husband of cousin Molohta who died in 1869 - took tea at Almiras - got Telegram of death of Becca Hathaway
entries.summaryText: Attended funeral of James Bushnell and received a telegram about the death of Becca Hathaway.

entries.fullText: 2 P.M. Funeral of Rebecca Hathaway - West Farmington mother & self left Phelps on 8 train & reached Cousin Hannah Hathaways at 9 - was Dreadfully cut down -came home on 4 P.M. Train -
entries.summaryText: Attended funeral of Rebecca Hathaway in West Farmington and visited cousin Hannah Hathaways.
